programName: Linguistics: Language Studies (Specialization in Individual Language) (B.A.)
fullProgramDescription: The Linguistics major with a specialization in Individual Language is designed for students who wish to focus on the in-depth study of a specific language. The program covers the structure, syntax, and semantics of the chosen language, as well as its historical and cultural context. Students gain a deep understanding of linguistic theory and its application to the language of their choice.
shortProgramDescription: The Linguistics major with a specialization in Individual Language provides students with a comprehensive understanding of a specific language and its linguistic structures.
classHighlights: The program requires students to complete a set of core linguistics courses, including Introduction to Linguistics (LING 100), Phonetics and Phonology (LING 101), Morphology (LING 102), and Syntax (LING 103).
Students also take courses specific to their chosen language, such as language-specific phonology, morphology, and syntax.
Electives in linguistic theory, language acquisition, and sociolinguistics provide further depth and context.
Courses in the department cover a range of languages, including but not limited to Spanish, French, German, Italian, Chinese, Japanese, and American Sign Language.
Students are encouraged to explore the linguistic and cultural nuances of their chosen language through coursework and research opportunities.
learningOutcomes: Apply linguistic theory to the analysis of a specific language.
Demonstrate an understanding of the phonological, morphological, and syntactic structures of the chosen language.
Analyze the historical and cultural context of the language.
Evaluate the role of language in shaping identity and culture.
Communicate complex linguistic concepts in written and oral form.
creditRequirements: Total: approximately 180 quarter units; major: 52-56 units
additionalInformation: Students must declare their major through the Department of Linguistics and meet with an advisor to plan their course of study.
